page.title: 11Longleat House
page.content: Longleat House was built in 1580 and is 405 years old. It was built by Sir John Thynne who was knighted by the Protector, the Duke of Somerset on the battle field of Pinkie whilst his wounds were still bleeding; he died in 1580 just before the house was completed. Today Longleat is not used by all the Thynn family but Viscount Weymouth and his family occupy a small part of it. Many tourists visit the house each year and marvel at its magnificent interior and beautifully restored kitchens which are no longer used for cooking the enormous meals of days gone by.
